rename.from: Can't download vagrant boxes from Jfrog artifactory with version 2.2.11 and up
rename.to: Can't download vagrant boxes from Jfrog artifactory with vagrant version 2.2.11 and up

body: We are experiencing the exact same issue. After some investigation it seems that the problem is that the Authorization HTTP header introduced in 2.2.11 contains the token in % escaped encoding. This makes authentication fail on Artifactory. My understanding of RFC2616 & RFC2396 is that escaped encoding is only permitted for URI's, but not in HTTP headers so this seems to be a Vagrant issue.

rename.from: Can't download vagrant boxes from Jfrog artifactory with vagrant version 2.2.11 and up
rename.to: Bug: Can't download vagrant boxes from Jfrog artifactory with vagrant version 2.2.11 and up

issue.title: Authentication w/ Vagrant Repo Failing in 2.2.13 and 2.2.14

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
### Vagrant version
2.2.13 and 2.2.14

### Host operating system
macOS v11.0.1 (Big Sur)

### Guest operating system
N/A

### Expected behavior
Upgrading Vagrant from v2.2.4 to v2.2.13 or 2.2.14 should break the authentication capabilities with a Vagrant Repo - if the authentication was working in v2.2.4 then it should continue to work in later versions of vagrant.

### Actual behavior
Neither vagrant v2.2.13 or 2.2.14 are authenticating properly with my vagrant repo.  I am getting a 401 with my repository after upgrading to these two versions.  If I downgrade my vagrant back to 2.2.4 then vagrant authenticates with the vagrant box repository without issue.

### Debug Output
[vagrant2.2.4-AddDebug-Redacted.log](https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/files/5599133/vagrant2.2.4-AddDebug-Redacted.log)
[vagrant2.2.13-AddDebug-Redacted.log](https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/files/5599134/vagrant2.2.13-AddDebug-Redacted.log)
[vagrant2.2.14-AddDebug-Redacted.log](https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/files/5599137/vagrant2.2.14-AddDebug-Redacted.log)

body: We are affected by this issue and have stopped upgrading vagrant because of this. This is also tracked in artifactory jira [here](https://www.jfrog.com/jira/browse/RTFACT-24061).

[This looks like the related change](https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/commit/b5f6df9ec04b7a42e4a93961a38b667adbdcf06d#diff-2466e752be66035eb11fb4c7e7f690528de62adee331eecbef6e58cacd2d96a2R58).
@soapy1 I'm afraid my ruby-fu is not that good. Is is possible to change this code so that the token value doesn't get escaped? (@CognexBela does this sound right?)
I'm able to confirm this behavior with Vagrant 2.2.14 and Artifactory 7.4.1. No issues when trying the same with Vagrant 2.2.7.

issue.title: vagrant up failed - split: bad URI

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
### Vagrant version

2.2.14 

### Host operating system

Windows 10 Build 18863

### Guest operating system

Linux.

### Vagrantfile

```
# Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
  config.vm.box = "cb-training-pipeline-fundamentals-1588693109"
  config.vm.box_url = "cb-training-pipeline-fundamentals-1588693109.box"
end
```



### Debug output

https://gist.github.com/Ed87/0490c316dfb8dedd08f8629ae4483979

### Expected behavior

VM should fire up without any issues

### Actual behavior

The VM is not booting but rather throwing up errors for a bad URI. The URI being referenced is my corporate proxy settings for Git Bash. 
I have already unset corporate proxy for Bash using  
git config --global --unset https.proxy
git config --global --unset http.proxy

Verified the same using 
git config --global -l (There are no proxies configured for Bash)

I am not working behind a corporate proxy but rather a private wifi network -- I have also diasbaled proxy in Windows settings


### Steps to reproduce

1. Install Vagrant and VirtualBox
2. Download VM's ZIP archive and extract to desktop 
3. cd to un-archived folder 
4. Run vagrant up 

### References


- https://github.com/udacity/fullstack-nanodegree-vm/issues/107
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26414803/vagrant-proxyconf-split-bad-uri-error-on-installing-plugin-for-vagrant

issue.title: Remove access_token url parameter for accessing vagrant repos

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

body: This issue should be resolved by https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/pull/12234
Hi @soapy1 this is great news and thank you for the work on this issue. Is it possible to get a build for me to test?
Heya, @rockdreamer one of these should work: https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant-installers/releases/tag/v2.2.15.dev%2Bmain
Thank you, I'll test right away :)

I'm sorry to say that my issue has not been resolved. I downloaded the installer provided, ran the uninstall script and installed the new vagrant build.
I have set up my environment thus:
- `export ATLAS_TOKEN=$(curl -s -u$USER:$ARTIFACTORY_API_KEY "https://mydomain/artifactory/api/vagrant/auth")`
- export VAGRANT_DEFAULT_PROVIDER=vmware_fusion
- export VAGRANT_SERVER_URL="https://mydomain/artifactory/api/vagrant/my-vagrant-repo"

I went in a folder with an ubuntu box and ran vagrant box update --debug
The logs ended with: 
```
There was an error while downloading the metadata for this box.
The error message is shown below:

The requested URL returned error: 401
```

Results were similar with VAGRANT_CLOUD_TOKEN instead of ATLAS_TOKEN.
I'm attaching the output of the command. (Company name and dns name replaced)
[vagrant.log](https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/files/6200623/vagrant.log)

I'll be very glad to help out testing this and can make printf debuggging changes if pointed at the right place :)
oh no! that certainly looks like an issue. Will open this back up  Thanks for taking the time to test this out!
